intro: Wahlenbergia perotifolia, commonly known as the silver bush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to blue. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It has a compact growth habit with silvery-gray foliage that gives it its common name. Wahlenbergia perotifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
